data.title: Quick lunch great food!
data.text: Stopped in for a quick bite while shopping downtown. Service was great and the food was better! I would recommend a burger! Enjoy a favorite local flying dog beer with your meal! Great choice for a quick bite while shopping.

data.title: Big appetite? Come and get some big food
data.text:
Rexs is a favorite because they really just serve a quality food in bigger than average portions. The staff is always friendly, the food is delivered quickly and the place is clean.

I prefer the upstairs dining.  Just seems a little more quiet and a respite from the comings and goings downstairs.

data.title: Glad we tried it!!!
data.text: I have passed this place dozens of times and kept saying I want to try that place. I'm so glad we finally did. Friendly staff, great burgers, fresh fries and tasty chicken tenders. All prepared quickly and brought to our table. Wanted to try a milkshake or smoothie but we were all too full. We will be back for sure. The location is a bit off Market St so it's a great place to slow down and relax with a great meal.

data.title: popular with local professionals!
data.text: We happened upon Rex's on our journey around Frederick. It was packed with local professionals on their lunch break. It is casual, order at the counter. My husband had the (huge) Cobb Salad, I went for the cold roast beef sub (served with tasty fries). Ladies, unless you are starving, split a lunch, I had to ask them to wrap 1/2 my sandwich. Rex's is reasonably priced with an expansive menu. Not fancy, but good food!

data.title: Very Impressed!
data.text: Had lunch at Rex's the other day and it was fantastic! The staff was friendly,and welcoming.  One of the owners greeted us and gave recommendations from the menu.  The turkey Reuben was excellent! My husband had the burger with avocado and bacon.  It was huge and he said it was the best burger he'd ever had.  We'll definitely go back to Rex's!

data.title: Perfect lunch after the museum
data.text: Right across the street from the Civil War Medicine Museum and we were hungry. The kid's cheeseburger (your choice of cheese) is the same size (huge) as the adult cheeseburger, just less expensive. The special was a steak and cheese and I could barely get my usually ample, if not oversized, mouth around it. 2 kids got grilled cheese, which they both enjoyed. Big pile of fries came with the entrees, and a large doggie bag went home with us. Food was very, very good. It was not crowded (little later than the usual mid week lunch) and service was excellent.

data.title: First time at this restaurant
data.text:
Neat little restaurant, in old town Frederick, casual, stopped there for lunch. Ordered a roast beef sandwich ($8.99) that comes with one side, other members had a hamburger and grilled chicken sandwich plus drinks. Total bill $42.00 which included tip. A little pricey, but food was very good, the French fries were hand cut and excellent. Service was fast. 
They have upstairs seating as well as the main entrance area seating.
When you order, you get a number and the server brings your order to the table, very efficient. Would recommend nice menu and all fresh.

data.title: Good meal
data.text: We stopped in because of the Flying Dog sign outside. The beer selection is good, and the food was delicious. The black bean burger was really good, as was the chicken salad. The fries weren't great, but they are fries- not a deal breaker. The teenage girl at the counter is a typical teenage girl- uninterested and not very friendly.  She wouldn't keep us from returning.

data.title: Huge salads for lunch here!
data.text:
After a morning of walking and shopping on East Patrick Street, my group of friends selected Rex's for our lunch spot.  What a treat it was!  A great selection of lunches on their menu:  burgers, sandwiches, salads, etc.

It was very clean, with plenty of indoor seating on a warm day.  We were welcomed by very friendly staff when we placed our orders, and they helped us with our questions on their menu.  Once our order was taken, it did not take very long for our meals to arrive to our table.  

My Chicken Cobb salad was a huge portion, and it was delicious!  We bought a few brownies to enjoy later in the day.  Yes, they were good too!  This is a wonderful place for a break from your shopping during day here.  Sit down and enjoy a delicious lunch.

data.title: Great Burgers, Floppy Greasy Stale Fries
data.text: It was our first time to this downtown restaurant. You place your order with at the front counter, take a number, and they bring the food to your table.  The mushroom and Swiss burger was moist and pretty good. The cheeseburger was topped with sweet instead of dill pickles and large slices of jalapeños. Unfortunately the fries were stale and super greasy. The cashier was also a bit confused or uninformed (?) as I asked for a root beer and she gave me a "Not Your Father's Root Beer", an alcoholic beverage! I had no idea until my friend told me that it contained 5% alcohol. Call me naive but since when does ordering a "root beer" = "alcoholic drink". As an aside, the root beer was too sweet and had a strange cough syrup like after-taste. If you eat here, you may want to hold off on the tip requested when the order is placed until after you are served your food and drink.

data.title: Best burger in area!! Fries are even better!!
data.text: I discovered Rex's Downtown Grill while visiting the National Museum of Civil War Medicine which is right across the street in this historical section of downtown Frederick.  Rex's fills a need for custom crafted sandwiches and burgers with the most amazing thinly cut french fries on the planet.  The venue is order from the counter and have food delivered by very friendly staff.  The decor is a refreshingly modern treatment of a historical building that fits in the area and delivers on aesthetic appeal.  This has become one of my favorite drop in eateries in the area.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: We asked a local shop owner for a suggestion, and she recommended Rex's.  When we are visiting a new place, we like to eat where the locals suggest, so we stopped in for lunch.  I ordered a turkey reuben and bacon cheese fries.  My sandwich was delicious, but the fries were burnt.  It was quite disappointing.  My husband ordered a bacon and blue burger and mac and cheese.  He said they were okay, but nothing spectacular.  I guess it's a good enough place for a burger joint, but the prices were a bit steep.  We paid just under $30 for our mediocre meal.

data.title: Don't Expect an Answer
data.text: I probably would have given Rex's a 4/5, as the fries and sandwich were good.  The salads were huge and looked amazing and fresh.  However, I had a very odd exchange with the girls at the counter.  (Me:  What type of cookie is this?  Girl 1:  A cookie.  Me:  Yes, I see that, but what is in it?  Girl 1: *Blank stare*. Girl 2:  It has a whole bunch of stuffed swirled together.  Me:  Well, can you at least tell me if it contains nuts? Girl 2:  There are no nuts here). Right... Call me crazy but I am not so confident in that statement.   One ought to know what is in the food one is serving if, for no other reason than the welfare of customers with allergies.

data.title: Really good fries and they grill the wings!
data.text: Great burgers, delicious fries, and they have flying dog beer. I love how they finish the wings on the grill. Yum yum!

data.title: Best Burger I've had- but you'll pay for it
data.text: First I was not expecting a walk-up and order/carry out style place so I had to readjust.  I'm glad I did. Best. Burger. Ever. And I'm a long time fan of the places in town known for their Hamburgers.  The fries were hand cut, but thinner so they were a nice crispness and slightly seasoned. Even the mac&cheese was freshly made from scratch.  The serving size was large. Saw a steak and cheese piled high. They do bring the food over to you after you've ordered and bus the tables so there is some service. BUT - you're  paying for what you get in terms of the food.  It is very pricey for what is basically a carry-out with tables. The vibe is okay - again - for the type of place it is (I don't like really bright places, so that's just personal preference). I used a Spotluck coupon and I'd go back again if I could share a meal with someone to defray cost.  I'd really love to have one of their meals in a dimmer full sit-down style restaurant.

data.title: Cool Place
data.text: This place has a great ruben and awesome milk shakes.  Took my daughter and her family for dinner. We sat in the window and watched all  the people walking by. Good food

data.title: Nobody working here is paying attention in this place
data.text:
We stopped here to grab a quick bite for lunch and the menu looked promising, but the food and service didn't deliver.  It's a self-service place, which is fine, but after you sit down it takes forever to get your food.  We waited almost 20 minutes for a cheese steak, burger, and chicken tenders.  Nearly everything was wrong on the cheese steak.  It was missing the lettuce, tomatoes, and onions, and it was very average or maybe a below average sub.  The burger was the best thing we had, but the fried onions were actually ice cold.  That only happens if they were not fresh and were pulled out of the fridge.  That's rather pathetic!  I've never experienced that with a burger.  The fries tasted good but they were extremely soggy, so that quality ruined them.

My daughter's chicken tenders were extremely dry and very generic, and the honey mustard was missing honey.  I mentioned it to to waitress and she said, "somebody must have forgotten to the put the honey in again."  I asked if this happens very often, and she said, "all the time.  It's either no honey or too much honey."

Where do these places find such useless employees?  Nothing was cooked right, service was slow, and there was absolutely no attention to detail with anything.  Even the napkins container and ketchup bottle were empty at our table.  And to make matters worse, we paid almost $35 for this debacle.

And another thing I witnessed was the breakdown in common sense on display when two employees were helping a couple with a baby.  They had the baby in a car carrier and there were no slings or chairs in which to place the carrier.  So the genius employees turned a high chair upside down so the car carrier could fit inside the bottom, now facing up.  This would have been fine but the chair bottom was rather grimy and the chair top, now facing down, was uneven.  And then they walked away leaving the couple of the baby wondering what the freak just happened.  It was both stupidity and carelessness on display.

Stay away from this place!

data.title: Late night dining
data.text: Came here after a late night of drinking. Very good burger and sweet potato fries.  Clean, fast service and tasty

data.title: Great little sandwich shop!
data.text: My friend and I were in town for some sightseeing and we got there just in time for lunch. We came out of the parking garage across the street and there was Rex's! We went to look at the menu, not sure what they had or what we wanted, and when we walked up to the store front, there appeared to be quite a few people inside. Not crowded or busy though. The sandwiches sounded great, so we went in. We were immediately greeted from the young lady behind the counter and placed our order. I had a roast beef & cheddar sandwich on sourdough. You got to pick your fixings, which I like, so I don't have to pick off anything I don't like. The sandwich was stuffed with tender, sliced roast beef, but not pile so high that I couldn't get my mouth around it. The bread was soft too. It came with fries, although you could pick another side, and they were hot, crispy boardwalk-style fries. The meal was delicious. And not outrageously priced. We thoroughly enjoyed our food and the ambience, even though they had TV's for the football crowd, it was not noisy. I would definitely recommend and go back!

data.title: Gorgeous restoration to historic building
data.text:
Met a friend for lunch and was delighted with the recent renovations to this grand old building. Very light and upbeat atmosphere. The upstairs dining room is very cool. 
Wish I could say I adored the food as much as the space. Actually my grilled ham & cheese was quite good and cooked dark just the way I requested. I just found it a little greasy (went through 4 or 5 napkins). My friend loved hers on rye and devoured her french fries. I should have gotten fries instead of the baked beans which I found watery and too oniony. 
I'll try it again another time, though.
